segments.text: Today more and more people advocate lifelong learning . But people have different views about lifelong learning . How do you understand lifelong learning ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think lifelong learning is the concept that it's never too soon or too late for learning
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Does that mean studying all the time ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't think so . I think it's about your attitude towards learning . One should be open to new ideas , decisions , skills or behaviors .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then the axiom - ' You can't teach an old dog new tricks ' doesn't work any longer .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're right . Lifelong learning is about finding learning opportunities at all ages and in numerous contexts
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I agree with you . When I retired I will participate in programs to keep momentally active .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Me too . To keep up with the changing world , one must be involved in lifelong learning and be ready to accept new things .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You know what ? I've recently been teaching myself French .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Really ? That's great ! I know that your company has a lot of clients in France .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , so I want to learn French to develop my career .
segments.speaker: S1
